"One, nine, two, nine.
When they meet, they don't put out their hands.
For the thirty-nine and twenty-seven, there's a shawl blowing at the end of the hedge.
He blows the shawm (a zurna) at the hedge.
For the fourth nine months, there are 36.
He sleeps at night like sleeping in the open air.
"Stay, stay, stay!
If he doesn't drink and stay, then...
It's almost past the first day of the first month.
The old man in the East Village burns his money at night.
He smashes his hand and points his hat at the sky.
The absence of a white marsh in the house brings misfortune and fortune.
When they're poor, they fry each other and suffer from hunger.
(Dongshan Cong) The king of the East Village burns money at night.
There's dust in his eyes and smoke in his mouth.
He attracts spirits and ghosts to become demons.
A three-legged toad flies up to heaven.
(Dizang En) The poor year-old king burns money at night.
It's difficult to meet a boat in the water that sends off.
They don't know they've reached the shore.
They simply push others away during the cold and heat.
(Duan'an Yan) The questions that come and go are answered from a certain source.
With one phrase, he fully explains the great chiliocosm.
"When the years are up, the bottom of the barrel is exhausted.
The old man in the East Village burns his money at night.
(JIAN WENG Jing) The spring breeze is like a boy on the street.
He uses the money he gets in his hand.
The goods suddenly match.
He runs into the right person.
(Xueyanqin)
"At present, there's no different path.
With his bare hands, he chops away at the square circle.
His eyebrows are crossed and his eyes are upturned.
His nostrils are hanging wide open.
(Seal of the Empty Old Man)
"The old man in the East Village burns his money at night.
He had to wipe out his family's treasures and store [deer*tile] piles.
His whole body is as light as a leaf.
Smoke arises again at the end of autumn at the sea-gate.

source_sentence: (森鑒徹)益州淨眾歸信禪師(青峰楚嗣)僧問蓮花未出水時如何。
translation: (Senghan Cheol) The Chan Master Jingsong Guixin of Yizhou (Qingfeng Chusi) was asked by a monk what happened when the lotus flowers were still in the water.
The master said, "The pond is filled with Nymphaea spp.
He asked what happened when they emerged from the water.
The teacher said he didn't know it was autumn when the leaves fell.
Tiantong Jueyun said.
"Li Ling was holding Hanjie.
Pan Long rode a donkey upside down.
Niu Mimi said before he waved his parting shot.
"Nāgârjuna is the fire emperor.
His latter words were.
"The bird officers are the emperors of men.
"The white lotus root is not yet sprouted, but it's not hidden.
The red flower emerging from the water isn't appropriate for the sun.
It's not necessary for a wanderer to send a message.
A clear breeze carries a distant fragrance on its own.
(Danxia Jun) Zongjian falin, vol. 67
